TheWord.ScriptureReference: Job 27:21, Isaiah 4:6, Isaiah 25:4, Isaiah 28:2, Ezekiel 38:9, Luke 8:23
TheWord.Title: They took the French by storm.

BibleWord.Commentary: The east wind carried him away, and he departed: and as a storm hurls him out of his place (Job 27:21). There shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the day time from the heat, and for a place of refuge, and for a covert from storm and from rain (Isaiah 4:6). For you have been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat, when the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall (Isaiah 25:4). Behold, the LORD has a mighty and strong one, which as a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, as a flood of mighty waters overflowing, shall cast down to the earth with the hand (Isaiah 28:2). You shall ascend and come like a storm, you shall be like a cloud to cover the land, you, and all your bands, and many people with you (Ezekiel 38:9). But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled with water, and were in jeopardy (Luke 8:23).

AlphabetSequence.Word: They took the French by storm.
